update.description:
The Windows version of Ogre from `vcpkg` is not adding support to link against plugins libs \(it is present in the Linux version\) [unless you create the static version of it](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/master/CMake/Templates/OGREConfig.cmake.in#L151). I’m copying the logic from the Config.cmake here.

Tested:

* Failing with linking problems:  \(grep for `fatal error LNK1120)`

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/39//badge/icon)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/39/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/39/))


* Linking fine:

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/51//badge/icon)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/51/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/51/))
update.title: Support for IgnOGRE to link against plugins libs in Windows shared version

pullrequest.title: Support for IgnOGRE to link against plugins libs in Windows shared version

content.raw:
Just checking do we need to split the strings into type and name? 

for the case of`RenderSystem_GL`, component\_type will be `RenderSystem` and component\_name will be `GL`? These two are joined back together in `ign_ogre_declare_plugin` with an underscore `_`. So we could just pass the `ogre_component` variable to and change the macro to take one arg?
content.html:
Just checking do we need to split the strings into type and name?

for the case ofRenderSystem_GL, component_type will be RenderSystem and component_name will be GL? These two are joined back together in ign_ogre_declare_plugin with an underscore _. So we could just pass the ogre_component variable to and change the macro to take one arg?
